author: Chloe Chaplain
title: London weather: Forty per cent chance of snow on Thursday evening, forecasters say
text:
Tuesday 10 January 2017 10:15 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Wintry showers: cold weather is heading towards the Capital PA 
Londoners have been warned to prepare for disruption on Thursday evening as forecasters predict a forty per cent chance of snow in the capital. 
The Met Office has warned that a band of "wintry showers" will pass over the city towards the end of the week as milder weather is replaced with a cold snap. 
A forecaster told The Standard: “There is a risk of snow as a band of rain moves through the channel and hits colder air – where it will turn into sleet and snow. 
“Thursday evening is going to be particularly unpleasant and there is a risk that the snow could cause disruption during rush hour. Cold snap transforms Europe - in pictures Cold snap transforms Europe - in pictures 1/11
